intro: Tillaea schimperi subsp. phyturus, commonly known as the Ethiopian snowbell, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pale blue or white. The plant grows in rocky, alpine habitats and is adapted to cold, arid conditions. It has small, hairy leaves and produces distinctive, elongated fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
